Authors: Prawati L.D., Setyawan M.H., Elsera M.
Title: The effect of tax rate, e-billing payment system, and e-filling system on micro, small and medium enterprises (MSMEs) taxpayer compliance in Jakarta
Source title: Proceedings of 2020 International Conference on Information Management and Technology, ICIMTech 2020
Affiliations: Bina Nusantara University, Faculty of Economics Communication, Accounting Department, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Directorate General of Treasury, Ministry of Finance of Republic, Indonesia; RSA Consult, Tax Consulting Department, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Prawati, L.D., Bina Nusantara University, Faculty of Economics Communication, Accounting Department, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Setyawan, M.H., Directorate General of Treasury, Ministry of Finance of Republic, Indonesia; Elsera, M., RSA Consult, Tax Consulting Department, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Abstract: The purpose of this study is to find the determining factors of Micro, Small and Medium Enterprises (MSMEs) Taxpayer compliance in KPP Pratama Kebon Jeruk Satu. The sample in this research uses Slovin formula with the total sample as many as 100 respondents. The primary data using questionnaires and analyzed with multiple linear regression method. The results indicated that the determination of tax rate and the implementation of e-billing system have a significant impact to Taxpayer compliance, while the implementation of e-filing system have no significant impact to Taxpayer compliance on Micro, Small and Medium Enterprises (MSMEs) in KPP Pratama Kebon Jeruk Satu. © 2020 IEEE.
Author Keywords: Determination of tax rate; E-billing system; E-filing system; Taxpayer compliance
Index Keywords: Information management; Linear regression; Surveys; Tantalum compounds; Billing systems; Filing systems; Filling system; Multiple linear regression method; Payment systems; Primary data; Small and medium enterprise; Tax rates; Taxation

Title: Factors that Influence the Use of e-Faktur: The Case of VAT Online Reporting
Source title: Proceedings of 2019 International Conference on Information Management and Technology, ICIMTech 2019
Affiliations: Accounting Department, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Prawati, L.D., Accounting Department, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Abstract: Reformation in the information technologybased taxation system was carried out by the Directorate General of Taxation to encourage a breakthrough by updating e-faktur. This research aims to examine the Effect of Perception of Self-Efficacy Perception, Perception of Usefulness and Perception of Ease to Use of e-faktur on Reporting Effectiveness of VAT online reporting in Indonesia.The results showed that the increasing Perception of SelfEfficacy Perception, Perception of Usefulness and Perception of Ease to Use of e-faktur causing effectiveness of VAT online reporting increased. © 2019 IEEE.
Author Keywords: e-faktur; perception of ease to use; perception of usefulness; self-efficacy perception; VAT online report
Index Keywords: Information management; Online reporting; Online reports; Self efficacy; Technology-based; Taxation

Authors: Prawati L.D., Endriarto W., Carolina A.I., Prabowo I.C., Tiong K., Sabrina S.
Title: Transformation of Tax Information System: Implementation of Financial Information Access (ASIK) and Procedures of Taxpayers Confiscation Assets in Indonesia
Source title: Proceedings of 2019 International Conference on Information Management and Technology, ICIMTech 2019
Affiliations: Accounting Department, Faculty of Economics and Communication, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Prawati, L.D., Accounting Department, Faculty of Economics and Communication, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Endriarto, W., Accounting Department, Faculty of Economics and Communication, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Carolina, A.I., Accounting Department, Faculty of Economics and Communication, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Prabowo, I.C., Accounting Department, Faculty of Economics and Communication, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Tiong, K., Accounting Department, Faculty of Economics and Communication, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Sabrina, S., Accounting Department, Faculty of Economics and Communication, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Abstract: The purpose of this study was to determine the effect of the implementation of Financial Information Access (ASIK) on the efficiency and effectiveness of the procedure for confiscating the Taxpayers' assets which is stored in banks by the Directorate General of Taxes. The respondent of this research are 81 Tax Bailiff Officer in Indonesia. The result shows that Perception of Ease of Use, Perception of Usefulness, Perception of Security and Confidentiality and Perceptions of service and information quality in the implementation of Financial Information Access (ASIK) affects the efficiency and effectiveness of the procedures for confiscating taxable assets held in banks by the Directorate General of Taxes. © 2019 IEEE.
Author Keywords: financial information access (ASIK); perception of security and confidentiality; perception of usefulness; perceptions of service and information quality; reception of ease of use
Index Keywords: Efficiency; Information management; Information retrieval; Taxation; Ease-of-use; Financial information; Indonesia; Information quality; Information use

Title: The analysis of factors which affect corporate taxpayer`s interest using e-filing system
Source title: Pertanika Journal of Social Sciences and Humanities
Affiliations: Accounting Department, Faculty of Economics and Communication, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Prawati, L.D., Accounting Department, Faculty of Economics and Communication, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Dewi, M.S., Accounting Department, Faculty of Economics and Communication, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Abstract: The purpose of this study is to examine the effects of performance expectation, quality system, and user satisfaction toward corporate taxpayers’ interest using e-filing system. The population of this study were 1.733 corporate taxpayers who are registered with Tax Office of Central Jakarta as respondents, and the samples were 100 respondents from the population. This study uses a non-probability convenience sampling technique and data was obtained from questionnaires distributed to the respondents. The study shows the variable of performance expectations, system quality, and user satisfaction simultaneously have a significant effect on corporate tax payer`s interest using e-filing system and among those variables, the system quality is the most dominant. © Universiti Putra Malaysia Press.
Author Keywords: E-filing; Performance expectations; Quality system; User satisfaction
References: DeLone, W.H., McLean, E.R., Information systems success: The quest for the dependent variable (1992) Information Systems Research, 3 (1), pp. 60-95; DeLone, W.H., McLean, E.R., The DeLone and McLean model of information systems success: A ten-year update (2003) Journal of Management Information Systems, 19 (4), pp. 9-30; Dewi, A.A.A.R., (2009) Analisis Faktor-Faktor Yang Mempengaruhi Penerimaan Wajib Pajak Terhadap Penggunaan E-Filling, , Studi Empiris Pada Wajib Pajak Badan di Kota Semarang; (2015) Directorate General of Taxes Regulation No. PER - 03/PJ/2015 about Procedures for Submission Tax Letter Notification Electronically, , Directorate General of Taxes; Gardner, C., Amoroso, D.L., Development of an instrument to measure the acceptance of internet technology by consumers (2004) System Sciences, 2004.
